rules: Rule1: Either John works on Project A or John works on Project B.
Rule2: Provided that an employee has access to files, the employee is logged in to the system.
Rule3: Whenever an employee is late for work, that employee misses a deadline.
Rule4: Given that a manager attended the meeting, if an employee is sitting on the office chair, the employee is not comfortable.
Rule5: If John works on Project B, then an employee is employed.
Rule6: The existence of a conflict between an employee and a manager leads to the conflict being resolved.
Rule7: A conflict between an employee and a manager implies that the conflict is not resolved.
Rule8: An employee working remotely implies that the computer is not connected to the network.
Rule9: Either a manager approved remote work or a manager denied remote work.
Rule10: If a manager denied remote work, then whenever an employee is using a computer, the employee is working remotely.
Rule11: Whenever the HR department reviewed a request, if a manager approved remote work, then an employee using a computer implies that the employee is working remotely.
Rule12: Either the HR department reviewed a request or the HR department processed a request.

Rule13: A request being finalized implies that if the HR department processed the request, then under the condition that a manager approved remote work, an employee using a computer leads to the employee working remotely.
Rule14: A request is pending or a request is finalized.
Rule15: The conference room is available, or if John works on Project A, then an employee is employed.
Rule16: An employee receiving a warning implies that the employee is not fired.
Rule17: If an employee submitted a complaint, then the employee is not terminated.
Rule18: Either an employee submitted a complaint or the HR department investigated a complaint.
Rule19: Provided that the HR department investigated a complaint, the HR department documented the complaint.
Rule20: A complaint being valid implies that the employee is not terminated.
Rule21: A complaint being resolved implies that the complaint is valid.
Rule22: Under the condition that the HR department followed procedure, if the HR department documented a complaint, then the complaint is resolved.
Rule23: An employee sitting on the office chair implies that the employee is comfortable.
Rule24: An employee is sitting on the office chair or the conference room is not available.
Rule25: An employee reporting the office chair as broken implies that if the chair is broken, then the employee is not sitting on it.
Rule26: An employee using a computer leads to the employee having access to files.
Rule27: Whenever an employee is using a computer, the computer is connected to the network.
Rule28: An employee being logged in to the system implies that the computer is not connected to the network.
Rule29: If it is not the case that missing a deadline implies the employee is not fired, then the employee is promoted.
Rule30: If it is not the case that a manager preparing for the meeting leads to the meeting being productive, then there is a conflict between an employee and a manager.
Rule31: Provided that it is not true that the absence of a scheduled meeting implying manager attendance results in the meeting being rescheduled, a manager prepared for the meeting.
Rule32: If it is not the case that an employee not being employed implies the employee received a warning, then the employee is terminated.
Rule33: An employee not being employed implies that the employee is fired.
Rule34: If an employee is not employed, then the employee is late for work.
Rule35: Provided that an employee is not employed, the employee is using a computer.
facts: Fact2: The HR department followed procedure.
Fact3: The office chair is broken.
Fact4: An employee reported the office chair as broken.
Fact5: It is not the case that an employee is promoted.
Fact6: A meeting is not rescheduled.
Fact7: A meeting is not productive.
Fact8: A request is not pending.
